Docs.summary: Enables a .NET Framework data provider to help ensure that a user has a security level adequate for accessing data.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("DBDataPermission(PermissionState state,Boolean allowBlankPassword) has been deprecated. Use the DBDataPermission(PermissionState.None) constructor. http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=14202", true)

Docs.param: Indicates whether a blank password is allowed.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of a class with the specified value, and a value indicating whether a blank password is allowed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> enumeration takes precedence over the <xref:System.Data.Common.DBDataPermission.AllowBlankPassword%2A> property. Therefore, if you set <xref:System.Data.Common.DBDataPermission.AllowBlankPassword%2A> to `false`, you must also set <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> to `None` to prevent a user from making a connection using a blank password.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Add (string connectionString, string restrictions, System.Data.KeyRestrictionBehavior behavior);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Add(string connectionString, string restrictions, valuetype System.Data.KeyRestrictionBehavior behavior) cil managed

Docs.param: String that identifies connection string parameters that are allowed or disallowed.
Docs.summary: Adds access for the specified connection string to the existing state of the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method can be useful when implementing:
- A .NET framework data provider.
- An API that must assert for data access permission.
- An administrative tool or installation program that must modify security policy.
- When more than one rule is specified, the more restrictive rule is selected.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool AllowBlankPassword { get; set; }
.property instance bool AllowBlankPassword

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a blank password is allowed.
Docs.value: if a blank password is allowed, otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> enumeration takes precedence over the AllowBlankPassword property. Therefore, if you set AllowBlankPassword to `false`, you must also set <xref:System.Security.Permissions.PermissionState> to `None` to prevent a user from making a connection using a blank password.

Docs.summary: Removes all permissions that were previous added using the <xref:System.Data.Common.DBDataPermission.Add%2A> method.

.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Copy() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates and returns an identical copy of the current permission object.
Docs.returns: A copy of the current permission object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A copy of a permission object represents the same access to resources as the original permission object.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void FromXml (System.Security.SecurityElement securityElement);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void FromXml(class System.Security.SecurityElement securityElement) cil managed

Docs.param: The XML encoding to use to reconstruct the security object.
Docs.summary: Reconstructs a security object with a specified state from an XML encoding.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Custom code that extends security objects needs to implement the `ToXml` and `FromXml` methods to make the objects security encodable.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Security.IPermission Intersect (System.Security.IPermission target);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Intersect(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission object to intersect with the current permission object. It must be of the same type as the current permission object.
Docs.summary: Returns a new permission object representing the intersection of the current permission object and the specified permission object.
Docs.returns: A new permission object that represents the intersection of the current permission object and the specified permission object. This new permission object is a null reference ( in Visual Basic) if the intersection is empty.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The intersection of two permissions is a permission that describes the set of operations they both describe. Only a demand that passes both original permissions will pass the intersection.

Docs.exception: The parameter is not a null reference ( in Visual Basic) and is not an instance of the same class as the current permission object.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool IsSubsetOf (System.Security.IPermission target);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsSubsetOf(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission object that is to be tested for the subset relationship. This object must be of the same type as the current permission object.
Docs.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the current permission object is a subset of the specified permission object.
Docs.returns: if the current permission object is a subset of the specified permission object, otherwise .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The current permission object is a subset of the specified permission object if the current permission object specifies a set of operations that is wholly contained by the specified permission object. For example, a permission that represents access to C:\example.txt is a subset of a permission that represents access to C:\\. If this method returns `true`, the current permission object represents no more access to the protected resource than does the specified permission object.

Docs.exception: The parameter is an object that is not of the same type as the current permission object.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsUnrestricted ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsUnrestricted() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the permission can be represented as unrestricted without any knowledge of the permission semantics.
Docs.returns: if the permission can be represented as unrestricted.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Security.SecurityElement ToXml ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.SecurityElement ToXml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an XML encoding of the security object and its current state.
Docs.returns: An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Custom code that extends security objects must implement the ToXml and <xref:System.Data.Common.DBDataPermission.FromXml%2A> methods to make the objects security encodable.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Security.IPermission Union (System.Security.IPermission target);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Union(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission object to combine with the current permission object. It must be of the same type as the current permission object.
Docs.summary: Returns a new permission object that is the union of the current and specified permission objects.
Docs.returns: A new permission object that represents the union of the current permission object and the specified permission object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The result of a call to Union is a permission that represents all the operations permitted by both the current permission object and the specified permission object. Any demand that passes either permission passes their union.

Docs.exception: The object is not the same type as the current permission object.
